caption: Ig - @oursceneos  Personally, I love this place. It has a very cozy, charming atmosphere, with many artists painting—it’s typically Parisian, right at its peak, something very French. Just one criticism: they removed the artists from the square and placed them around dining spots. I believe the most important thing is the tradition and the atmosphere, rather than the food.

Only award winning artists are allowed to work and sell original pieces at the plaza. Highly recommend to stop by and appreciate the local arts.  There are many restaurants and cafes around. Our tour guide did not recommend anyone trying, because of possible tourist traps. We don’t sample the food or drinks but enjoyed the relax scene at the plaza.  Recommend time to spend: 15-20 minutes.

Place du Tertre: A Parisian Gem Place du Tertre, nestled atop Montmartre, is a picturesque square that exudes the quintessential charm of Paris. The cobblestone streets, quaint cafes, and vibrant atmosphere create a truly enchanting ambiance. One of the highlights of visiting Place du Tertre is the opportunity to witness talented artists at work. From painters capturing the essence of Paris to caricaturists creating humorous portraits, there's a unique artistic experience to be found at every corner. While the square can get crowded, especially during peak tourist seasons, it's well worth the visit. Whether you're seeking inspiration, a delicious meal, or simply a place to soak up the Parisian atmosphere, Place du Tertre is sure to delight.

Place du Tertre, also known as Artists' Square, is a lively and vibrant square located at the top of Montmartre, Paris. It has long been a gathering place for artists, who set up their easels and display their paintings, portraits, and sketches for visitors. The square captures the essence of the bohemian spirit that once defined Montmartre, with its colorful art, street performers, and charming cafés. Historically, Place du Tertre was a hub for famous artists like Picasso, Van Gogh, and Toulouse-Lautrec.  Today, it remains a must-visit destination for tourists seeking to experience the artistic heritage of the area. Whether you’re looking to purchase a piece of art, have your portrait painted, or simply enjoy the lively atmosphere, Place du Tertre offers a unique and authentic glimpse into the artistic soul of Paris.

Charming plaza with restaurants, patios and artists.  Affordable and delicious crepes and baked goods available for take out at Carette.   Sit-down restaurants are pricey, but you pay for the atmosphere.  The Dali museum is nearby.

When you come to Paris, you cannot skip a visit to beautiful Montmartre, for me the most amazing thing to do in Paris after visiting nearly everything.  This square in particular is so charming with its many cute artists with beautiful paintings.  Just sit yourself at one of the many bars and enjoy the atmosphere.

Local artists, lots of cafes, vintage clothing shops if walking here, some cafes have a singer with traditional French music. Church with beautiful bells. Trolley to take you around if the hills are too much for walking. Love the vibe here, very artsy, but full of tourists, that’s the only draw back but totally doable.

Place du Tertre is a famous square located in the heart of Montmartre, Paris. Known for its artistic history, it is often associated with the bohemian lifestyle that flourished in the area during the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Today, it is a lively spot filled with street artists, painters, caricaturists, and tourists. The square is only a short distance from the iconic Sacré-Cœur Basilica and has retained much of its charm despite becoming a major tourist attraction. Artists set up their easels daily, offering portraits and paintings for sale, continuing Montmartre's legacy as a hub for creative talent. Historically, famous artists like Picasso, Toulouse-Lautrec, and Modigliani lived and worked in Montmartre, making the Place du Tertre an enduring symbol of Parisian art and culture.
A very atmospheric place with plenty of different shops, souvenir stalls, and artists painting in real-time. The music and overall vibe are fantastic. Highly recommend visiting!
A wonderful retail village right around the corner of the Sacre Coeur cathedral. Excellent restaurants and local artists work.
The Montmartre neighborhood is amazing, the atmosphere is excellent, a must-see after visiting the Basilica.

Pleasant environment. Some reviews says it was dangerous with pick pockets there, but the strong police presence makes it feel safe for tourist.  Walk to the Basilica. The view of the entire Paris was amazing.

This is a must see sight when visiting Paris. We had dinner here at L Bohemia, one of the many restaurants. I enjoyed taking it all in.  I encourage anyone visiting Paris to make the trip up to Monmartre for the True Bohemian experience
Square with artists and cafe/restaurants in the square. One of Montmarte’ busy places to the left of the church. Gets very busy though.

This place is crazy busy, quite disappointing to be honest to have restaurants on every corner. I couldn't find that many artists or local galleries. It is obvious that tourists are being targeted to spend their money on pricey meals.

Yes it's extremely (and busily) touristy, but it somehow it retains its charm, like much of the rest of Montmartre. It's hard to resist sitting at one of the portrait sketchers. The tacky gift shops are interspersed with genuinely delightful art shops. It has a real buzz.

Had a wonderful visit soaking in the tourist spots of Monmartre. Great restaurants with friendly service, souvenir shops, artists, galleries. And wonderful views of Paris spread before you from vantage point on the hill that can be reached by stairs or funicular.

Place du Tertre in Paris is a great place to stroll through! This is a very charming area. Lots of quaint shops and unique restaurants lining the street. All the lights and music playing made for a wonderful night. We didn't see any of the artists out in the evening, unfortunately. I hope to return in the summer to see this plaza come alive during the day!
Beautiful little square with restaurants and French artists selling their wares. A must see if you’re visiting Montemarte or the Basilica.
Plenty of lovely restaurants, we bought some cute mini watercolors of Paris to take home.

We visited this place in early spring and in weekend very traditional French ambiance nice area with plenty of cafes and restaurants you can chose any cuisine but of course the recommended one is French here where you can try many traditional French food if you like to walk than be ready as the area is big and nice we enjoyed
Absolutely stunning place, atmospheric, full of cute little restaurants, surrounded by talented painters.

I had stayed around there around 2017 and it was busy with artists and some tourists but not much else. It was one of the most charming spots in the city. I was disappointed to see how it changed when I was there last week . Now half the square is covered with restaurants (they used to be just cute places on the sides before). Also it was much busier than before, which brought all the unwanted tourist traps etc.
Such a quaint place to visit. I highly recommend, if your looking; for stunning views, quaint cafes, free to visit cathedral. Please note, there were alot of steps up to here!

I really recommend to go here. There are many many artists who paint portraits or sceneries, and you can either let yourself be painted, or enjoy seeing the many other people get painted. There’s a very cozy vibe, with lots of restaurants and artists, which with most of them you can really see they enjoy what they’re doing. Furthermore there’s the moulin rouge, some basilisks, and a very nice view of the city downtown.
You should visit for the view of Paris, a trip to Sacré-Cœur, and then a lovely lunch. Don’t leave Paris without seeing this place. Have a great time!
A great place to walk around and explore. It is full of street artists, souvenir shops, cafes and restaurants.
What a special place-  love to see the artists at work in the same place that many famous artists painted.
Lovely atmosphere and scenery. A lot to see. Multiple food options. Life music, paintings. Stunning area , must visit.

Was beautiful the art was absolutely stunning and there was a great atmosphere in the whole square. Would recommend going! The food is quite over prices at the restaurants in the area but what can you expect from such a big tourist attraction?

The highlight of my visit. The history and architecture of Paris is amazing but Place du Tertre allows you to experience Paris as many have done before, with the resident artists. I spent time wondering across cobbled stones, watching them work and chatting to those not busy. They come from near and far and each adds to the spirit of captured memories. Lots of brasseries to choose from and Montmartre and Dali museums right there. And a few steps away is Sacre Coetre, a basilica overlooking Paris. Well worth the visit, especially if you appreciate art.

This place is very touristy but very lively. Lots of sites to see and places to eat. Kind of like a fair atmosphere. Quite a fun walk to get here from the metro. It’s enjoyable to walk around here and see the different artist and people watch.

A charming spot in Montmartre.  The experience here depends greatly on what time of year you visit.  I have visited in both November and April.  In November, the square is mostly empty and quite.  In April it is brimming with tourist and energy.  I don't recommend trying to drive in the area during the tourist season because the pedestrians are so thick the cars cannot move.  We enjoy visiting the square and looking at the artists working.
I recommend a visit just walking around   and eating something to experience the vibes.

This is a very colourful square, full of artists’ stalls eager to sketch/paint your portrait, or sell you a painting. From observation beware the touts walking around trying to convince you to have your portrait done, if its something you want, go to the square, and find an artist you like.  If you want a portrait painting then this is a good place to get on. It's a square surrounded by restaurants where artists sit and you can have a portrait painted. There were ones that were even painting a portrait from photos that visitors had wanted.
This is such a beautiful, romantic place to visit, we high up scenery and views. Lots of restaurants, bars,café and street markets, very pretty, worth a visit, tram if you find steep steps difficult.

This place was really great! A small little Street of artists. This place in more active in the afternoon like after 2pm or so. You can also get a portrait or drawing done by one of the artists in the street. The price varies artist to artist. Prices range from €30 per person to €60 per person.

Place du Tertre is a nice small place at hill behind Montmartre church. The place ia full of vibrant atmosphere with gift shops, creperie, bars and restaurants. There are painters making your sketches. You can see Paris city from here. There are cars going around in this small place which is bit cautious.
